definition: a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]

sentences.chinese: 对古代碑铭文字的研究。

sentences.english: According to the inscription on its cornerstone, this building was erected in 1919。
sentences.chinese: 根据基石上的碑铭，这栋建筑物建于1919年。

sentences.english: The inscriptions on the ancient monuments have been effaced by time.
sentences.chinese: 岁月抹去了古碑上的碑铭。

sentences.english: The inscriptions on the ancient monuments have been effaced by time.
sentences.chinese: 这个古建筑上的碑铭随着时间的推移被抹去。

sentences.english: After he had made his selection , the stonecutter asked him what inscription he would like on it.
sentences.chinese: 他选好了以后，石匠问他，要在墓碑上刻什么碑铭。

sentences.english: He read the inscription before the tomb.
sentences.chinese: 对古代碑铭文字的研究。

sentences.english: This inscription was written by Yan Zhenqing, the great calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这个碑铭出自唐代大书法家颜真卿的手笔。

sentences.english: This stone tablet was from Wu, which was established by Yang Hsin Mi in the period of Five-Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 本碑铭，是我国五代时期，杨行密所创建的吴国之物。

definition: a record of events inscribed on a tablet
stele/vertical stone tablet for carved inscriptions
inscribed stone tablet placed in the tomb/memorial inscription on such a tablet
the top part of a tablet
a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]
